data.title: Duplication in folded code
data.body:
![codefoldbug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1216870/2981716/a271ef08-dc0a-11e3-8a9a-5d5a4f50d1bb.gif)

As above - this particular structure causes the following fold to duplicate when unfolded, then throws an error on further folding.

Dev console spits out
`Uncaught TypeError: Cannot call method 'getBufferRange' of undefined`
`/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app/src/editor-view.js:846`

data.title: Make ctrl+click add a new cursor in Linux and Windows, fixes #2105
data.body: In Chromium the metaKey property of a mousedown event might never get set to true on Linux and Windows as there is no special, well defined meta key on the keyboard (see this [issue](https://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=95874)). Hence I made editor-view.coffee check for e.ctrlKey instead if the platform is not Mac, which makes ctrl+click to add a cursor as desired.

data.title: Double pasting bug
data.body:
Using Atom since yesterday I encountered the following bug: Hitting Ctrl-V pastes copied code twice. However, undoing that takes two hits on Ctrl-Z, so I suppose that the action `core:paste` and the native Chromium/Webkit paste are both called with Ctrl-V. Removing this entry from the internal keybind solved the problem for me but I dont think that is a proper solution.

I'm running Ubuntu 13.10 on a 64-Bit machine.

PS: sorry for my english ;)

data.title: :memo: Document process for hacking node module components
data.body:
@ProbablyCorey documented this process on Discuss and I figured it should be added to the official documentation. I hope that I was able to match the documentation practices the Atom team uses for general documentation.

See: http://discuss.atom.io/t/how-to-setup-development-for-core-modules-like-atom-keymap/9221/18?u=leedohm

Closes #2265

data.title: In API docs ctrl+c renders left frame to 404
data.body:
When loading the currently latest docs the left frame on page gets this source:
https://atom.io/docs/api/v0.94.0/api/class_list.html
When some text is copied to clipboard (ctrl+c) then the left frame reloads to:
https://atom.io/docs/api/v0.94.0/api/docs/class_list.html

That is a 404. Happens on Win7x64 Chrome 34, but probably everywhere without a cmd button on keyboard.

data.title: Package search fails with more than one search term.
data.body:
This is built on Windows 8.

Basically, if you open the preferences and go to Packages, you can search normally for single terms, but when you add another it fails. As seen here:

![tmp gif gif](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1729810/2974988/b19bba66-db8f-11e3-8f50-6ea0e2228c01.gif)

data.title: "Show in finder" command doesn't work (and is a weird name)
data.body:
On GNU/Linux the "Show in finder" command doesn't work. It fails with an error stating:

> open: invalid option -- 'R'

I suspect it is calling `open`, which I guess may open Finder on Mac OS X, but which has nothing to do with file browsers on Linux. :grinning: 

On GNU/Linux I would advise using `xdg-open`, which will pick the default file-browser for the user's desktop environment (Nautilus for Gnome Shell and Unity).

![2014-05-14-172620_1920x1080_scrot](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/683699/2973273/4ec491f0-db7c-11e3-9410-c4dda13adb9f.png)

Also, it would be nice to use a more generic term for this action, such as "show in file browser".

data.title: Update linux.md

data.title: Make hard tabs align to columns.
data.body:
This fixes issue #1845, at least for hard tabs.

I'm not sure what the proper behaviour for soft tabs should be, but this ought to leave them as before.

data.title: Split doesn't work while in Fullscreen (Mac OSX Mavericks)
data.body:
As it says in the title..

Can't enter a split while in full screen, can however fullscreen after split has happened.

data.title: Stores built package in /tmp/atom-build
data.body:
/tmp/atom-build is where built things go to.  And it just so happens to be the worst place to store this, because:
- many people use tmpfs (aka ram-drive), which means that the package gets destroyed at reboot.
- others have their /tmp purged at boot, or specific time intervals.

Which forces one to rebuild atom _every reboot_.

This shouldnt be the default.  The default should be something more likely to stay alive, like /opt.  Or /usr/local.
